headline.print_headline: Bringing Home Ec Back to the Classroom
headline.main: Bringing Home Ec Back to the Classroom

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to a recent Op-Ed in support of home economics courses to help students learn about healthy food preparation.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to a recent Op-Ed in support of home economics courses to help students learn about healthy food preparation.

headline.print_headline: Attacking the Obesity Epidemic by First Figuring Out Its Cause
headline.main: Attacking the Obesity Epidemic by First Figuring Out Its Cause

docs.lead_paragraph: A series of reports in The Lancet lays out the reasons why the number of overweight Americans began skyrocketing in the 1970s, and how the problem can be brought under control.
docs.snippet: A series of reports in The Lancet lays out the reasons why the number of overweight Americans began skyrocketing in the 1970s, and how the problem can be brought under control.

headline.seo: Health and Financial Costs of Being Overweight or Obese
headline.print_headline: The Numbers Behind an Urgent Fight
headline.main: The Numbers Behind an Urgent Fight

docs.lead_paragraph: If the increase in the proportion of Americans who are overweight or obese is not slowed down, about three of four Americans will be overweight or obese by 2020.
docs.snippet: If the increase in the proportion of Americans who are overweight or obese is not slowed down, about three of four Americans will be overweight or obese by 2020.

headline.seo: Excerpt — That Used to Be Us — By Thomas L. Friedman and Michael Mandelbaum

byline.original: By THOMAS L. FRIEDMAN and MICHAEL MANDELBAUM

docs.lead_paragraph: “A reader might ask why two people who have devoted their careers to writing about foreign affairs — one of us as a foreign correspondent and columnist at The New York Times and the other as a professor of American foreign policy at The Johns Hopkins University School of Advanced International Studies — have collaborated on a book about the American condition today.”

headline.print_headline: Vegetable Gardens Are Booming in a Fallow Economy
headline.main: Vegetable Gardens Are Booming in a Fallow Economy

docs.lead_paragraph: Rural residents are relying more on locally grown food to save money — or earn it. Some see health benefits, too.
docs.snippet: Rural residents are relying more on locally grown food to save money — or earn it. Some see health benefits, too.
